thread.title: Obama And Chinese President Xi Jinping Reach Agreement On Cyber Spying Issues
thread.title_full: Obama And Chinese President Xi Jinping Reach Agreement On Cyber Spying Issues

author: Sam Levine
title: Obama And Chinese President Xi Jinping Reach Agreement On Cyber Spying Issues
text:
Obama And Chinese President Xi Jinping Reach Agreement On Cyber Spying Issues They said "neither country's government would conduct or knowingly support cyber-enabled theft of intellectual property." By Roberta Rampton, Jeff Mason and Michael Martina Posted: 09/25/2015 12:37 PM EDT 
WASHINGTON, Sept 25 (Reuters) - U.S. President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping agreed on Friday to take new steps to address cyber spying issues, saying in a joint statement that neither country's government would conduct or knowingly support cyber-enabled theft of intellectual property. 
The two leaders agreed to create a senior expert group to further discuss cyber issues, and a high-level group to talk about how to fight cyber crime that will meet by the end of 2015 and twice a year after that, the White House said in a statement.
